title: [$250] Admin can pay report in Expensify Classic but not New Expensify

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.85-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1766184315448559) ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Create a workspace as admin A, and add a business bank account to the workspace. Set admin A as workspace payer. Add admin B to the workspace as an admin who has access to the same business bank account. Set admin B as the approver. Invite employee C to the workspace as a member. 1. As employee C, submit a report with an expense 2. As admin B approve the report. This sends it to admin A to pay 3. Go to the report as admin A in both Expensify Classic and New Expensify 4. Verify you see the option to pay it 5. Go to the report as admin B in Expensify Classic 6. Verify you see the option to pay it 7. Go to the report as admin B in New Expensify ## Expected Result: You see the option to pay the report like in Expensify Classic. ## Actual Result: The option to pay the report is not shown in NewDot. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/626988eb-7aeb-46e9-bc29-8efff214e766 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a048d592-8e1a-45ad-a624-0e46d921e38b [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.85-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijsndojojsiojioj@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense. 4. Open the expense report. 5. Click More > Split > Save. 6. Open any split and delete it. 7. On the remaining expense, click More > Duplicate. 8. Open the first expense. 9. Click Review duplicates. 10. Click Keep this one on the second expense preview. ## Expected Result: Confirm page will open. ## Actual Result: Keep this one button opens not here page after deleting split and duplicating expense. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9ba5aa12-28de-407f-b963-649a82c3dcbf [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

## Action Performed:
Break down in numbered steps

1. Navigate to your workspace chat
2. Click to create expense
3. Scan a receipt

## Expected Result:

User is taken to the confirmation page to finish the expense creation

## Actual Result:
Describe what actually happened

The page navigated to the confimation page but immediately moves back

Can the user still use Expensify without this being fixed? Have you informed them of the workaround?

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked due to card expense) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @stephanieelliott **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#expensify_bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1766110788975549) ## Action Performed: Precondition: Have 2 accounts on the same workspace, one with a verified business bank account 1. From the account with a VBBA, send an invoice to the other account (payer) 2. As the payer, pay the invoice with a credit card 3. As the payee/VBBA owner, see the message: [payer] started payment, but is waiting for [payee/VBBA account] to add a bank account. ## Expected Result: To have the payment sent to the payee's linked VBBA ## Actual Result: Payee sees a message to add VBBA despite them already having one ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos Additional information in the [OP](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1766110788975549) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.85-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2467/folder/13176923/41237530/1086559026 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Win 11/Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a workspace setting submission manually, disable Approvals, enable Payments 3. Navigate to this workspace chat create and submit a manual expense 4. Click on Reports tab 5. Click on Pay section and observe this expense is displayed 6. Click on workspace setting enable Approvals 7. Click on Reports/Pay section and observe 8. At search box type "action:pay" and search ## Expected Result: After enable Approvals, the expense created at step 3 should display in Reports/Pay section ## Actual Result: After enable Approvals, Reports/Pay section is empty state ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5a5a303d-7ca0-491b-a60e-5fe237ea190a [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Confirm details - Unit doesn't change from Km to Mile when switching workspaces after selecting non-default rate

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: BZ Test Jan 26
labels.description: Lauren R running tests on removing BZ from certain parts in issue flows

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.85-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2467/folder/13176744/41237142/1086558789 and https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2467/folder/13176744/41237140/1086558788 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck12192510@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome, iPhone 16/iOS 18.3.1, Pixel 8a/Android 16 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Preconditions: On User A's side 1. Workspace created with Distance rates enabled 2. Few additional distance rates added 3. Changed the unit to kilometer in settings 4. Invited User B as member to workspace On User's B side 1. User B has created his default workspace with distance rates enabled Steps: 1. [User B] - Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. [User B] - Click FAB >> Track Distance >> Map option >> Enter waypoints >> Next 3. Observe To field has User's B default workspace with default distance rate/mile ($0.7/mile) & take note of distance & amount 4. Switch to User's A workspace in To field 5. Observe rate field has default rate with kilometer unit ($0.7/kilometer) 6. Change rate to non-default one 7. Switch to User's B default workspace in To field 8.Observe incorrect unit displayed in Rate field which changes the distance & amount values ## Expected Result: When User B switches from User's A workspace to User's B default workspace, the Rate field unit should change from kilometer to mile & reflect correct distance & amount ## Actual Result: When User B switches from User's A workspace to User's B default workspace , the Rate field unit still display kilometer & does not change to mile unit which is User's B workspace default unit. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

  • Upwork Job ID: 2003058270992773869
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-12-22
